title: Algebra Builder
description: Wave 1: Identifying basic algebraic components and terms.

questions.question: How many terms are in the expression $2x + 3y - 5$?
Which of these is a variable?
Which of these is a constant?
Is $3x = 12$ an expression or an equation?
How many terms are in the expression $a^2 + b^2$?
Which of these is an expression?
Is $y - 2$ an expression or an equation?
What is the operation in $4 \times z$?
What is '$b$' in the expression $a + b - c$?
How many terms are in the expression $m \times n$?
Which of these is an equation?
What is the operation in $a - b$?
What is '$z$' in the expression $12 - z$?
How many terms are in the expression $x^2 + 2x + 1$?
Is $a + b$ an expression or an equation?
What is '$15$' in the expression $15 - y$?
How many terms are in the expression $3x$?
Is $x < 5$ an expression or an inequality?
How many terms are in the expression $a + b$?
Evaluate: $p \times q + r$ when $p=2, q=3, r=4$
Evaluate: $x^2 + y^2 - z^2$ when $x=5, y=4, z=3$
Solve the system of equations: $x+y=7$ and $x-y=3$
A rectangle has a length of $2x+5$ and a width of $x-1$. What is its perimeter?
The sum of two consecutive integers is 25. Find the integers.
If $f(x) = x^2+1$ and $g(x) = x-1$, find $f(x) - g(x)$.
Solve the system of equations: $y=x+1$ and $2x+y=7$
The area of a triangle is $15$ square units. If its base is $x+2$ and its height is $3$, what is the value of $x$?
If $f(x) = x^2-x$ and $g(x) = x+5$, find $f(x) + g(x)$.
A number is 3 more than twice another number. Their sum is 18. Find the numbers.
Solve the system of equations: $x+2y=8$ and $x-y=2$
A car travels at a speed of $3x$ mph for $2$ hours and then at $x+10$ mph for $1$ hour. What is the total distance traveled?
If $f(x) = x^3$ and $g(x) = x^2$, find $f(2) + g(3)$.
The perimeter of a square is $4x+12$. What is the length of one side?
If $f(x) = x^2+2x$ and $g(x) = x+1$, find $f(x) - g(x)$.
Solve the system of equations: $y=2x$ and $x+y=9$
